instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage and does not turn on  <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> only 0.055V

Resistance to ground 80 ohm

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Voltage on the other big coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
L7430 0v   0.095 diode mode

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin 2 0v pin 17 3.2 pin 16 3.3v  1.8v pin 20  0.028v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You should change <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, if gets 5V at pin 12.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
changed <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> but no change.

Changed <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> and had fan spin for several seconds then board tuned off with no fan spin

Back to 5V on pin 12

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Check all components, traces ans solders around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.
